lines.text: You and me, we're gonna have a fight. Today. After school. Three o'clock. In the parking lot. You try and run, I'm gonna track you down. You go to a teacher, it's only gonna get worse. You sneak home, I'm gonna be under your bed.

I want you to understand something Jerry. I don't like people knowing about me, in fact I don't like it when ANYONE knows about me. So you can take that paper of yours and wipe off your dick with it! You made me mad Jerry... now I'm gunna have to do something to work it off...
Don't fuck this up, Mitchell!
Being flunked beats being dead.

Its a good read, fast angry sexual. I was thinking about the syntax and how it affected the overall mood. Particularly in the more expository passages; in the fifth chapter where honey meets the whole Australian soccer team.
Pain is temporary, film is forever.
Nobody escapes from the Duker!
You are the puss that always bled.
Cripple the dick!
I heard you're giving Jerry Mitchell a hard time, man.
Yeah. And it's gonna get even harder.
You know what Mitchell? You're the biggest pussy I've ever seen in my life. Didn't even try. How does that feel?
I want my money back!
No refunds.
I'm no pussy, asshole! The fight is on, you and me, in the parking lot.
There isn't going to be any fight today!
If I can get the money, do you think he'll do it for me?

[to Jerry]
Revell will never bother you again.

[Vincent holds up a knife]
You want me to stab him? Are you crazy?
Of course not. We plant this sucker in his locker.
Come on, you asshole! Come on, you peckerhead... let's see what you got!
